A book is a medium for recording information in the form of writing or images, typically composed of many pages (made of papyrus, parchment, vellum, or paper) bound together and protected by a cover. The technical term for this physical arrangement is codex (plural, codices). In the history of hand-held physical supports for extended written compositions or records, the codex replaces its predecessor, the scroll. This book uses obsolete yet classical, handmade bookmaking techniques- ranging from hand-composed letterpress printing to direct printing from hand-carved woodcut matrixes.
